header.title: C.I.A.
header.subtitle: Welcome to the Club d'Intelligence Artificielle (CIA) of Laval University!

about.title: About Us
about.description: We are a group of students exploring AI through various hands-on projects. Join us to learn and collaborate on exciting AI initiatives!

flapeeg.title: FlapEEG
flapeeg.description: An innovative video game controlled by brain waves (EEG). Discover how AI and neurotechnology let you pilot a virtual bird with your thoughts. A pioneer brain–computer interface project open to every profile (neuro, AI, dev, design).

f1tenth.title: F1Tenth
f1tenth.description: Autonomous racing with 1:10th-scale F1 cars powered by EMG (muscle) signals and embedded AI. Join the team to design control algorithms, work on embedded robotics, and take part in technical competitions. Open to robotics, AI, hardware, and software enthusiasts.

decisiontree.title: TreeCore
decisiontree.description: Research and development around decision trees: explore classic and advanced algorithms, optimize automated decision-making, and help deliver open-source tooling for AI. Ideal for students in data science, mathematics, and computer science.

lenia.title: Lenia
lenia.description: Autonomous cellular automata inspired by artificial life: simulate virtual creatures capable of emergence, evolution, and interaction. This project combines mathematics, simulation, AI, and scientific visualization. Join us to explore digital life and creative algorithms.

mangaai.title: MangaAI
mangaai.description: Automatic manga translation and analysis powered by AI: OCR, NLP, dialogue generation, and style analysis. Help build tools for Japanese culture, computational linguistics, and computer vision. Perfect for fans of AI, manga, and language processing.

canlock.title: CANlock
canlock.description: Partner project with Thales: design an intelligent system to detect attacks on the vehicle CAN bus. Objective: reduce false positives and deliver a production-ready pipeline. Profiles sought: AI/Data, Cybersecurity, Embedded.

drone.title: Drone - Laser Tag
drone.description: Build a turnkey laser system for an autonomous FPV competition: 180° sensor, emission module, custom PCB, and centralized management software. Academic partner: Philippe Giguère. Team Lead: Anthony Lavertu.

sgd-beyond.title: SGD - Beyond
sgd-beyond.description: Analyze and enhance a foundational AI algorithm (SGD) by integrating a noise-based optimization method. Find more details and code on GitHub.

nutrinov.title: NutriNov
nutrinov.description: Identify a real nutritional challenge and develop a viable tech prototype — in partnership with Open Food Facts. Project type: Entrepreneurial initiative. Team Lead: Eloïse Prevot.

poppy-conception.title: Poppy Humanoid (Conception)
poppy-conception.description: 3D print components, assemble joints, and integrate electronics for an open-source humanoid robot. Join the project to contribute to mechanical and mechatronic design.

poppy-simulation.title: Poppy Humanoid (Simulation)
poppy-simulation.description: Teach a robot to walk by developing reinforcement learning algorithms in simulation and transferring them to the real robot. Join the project to explore robotic AI.

collaboration.title: Interested in collaborating?
collaboration.description: Sponsors help us achieve our goals and bring our projects to life. Interested in collaborating with us? Check out our plans.

footer.slogan: Let's bring your projects to life.

collaborationPage.subtitle: Invest in the Future of AI Research
collaborationPage.intro: Join our mission to push the boundaries of AI technology. Your sponsorship fuels cutting-edge research, empowers student innovators, and creates solutions that transform industries.
collaborationPage.readyText1: Join forward-thinking organizations that are shaping the future of artificial intelligence. Our partnerships provide more than just exposure – they offer direct access to cutting-edge research, talented students, and innovative solutions.
collaborationPage.readyText2: Custom sponsorship packages are available for organizations with specific research interests or collaboration goals. Let's discuss how we can create value together.
collaborationPage.contactMessage: How would you like to support our projects?

aboutMe.dereck: Hi, my name is Dereck! I am very passionate about computer science in general but mostly AI, cybersecurity and web development. Outside work/school, I do mixed martial arts and run a bunch. I love neuroscience and chess. Feel free to contact me if you have questions about the club, requests for the website or want to chat!

meta.title: FlapEEG - Revolutionizing Gaming with Thought-Controlled AI
meta.description: FlapEEG is a groundbreaking thought-controlled video game powered by AI and EEG technology. Discover how we trained an AI model to interpret brain signals and control the game.
meta.keywords: FlapEEG, EEG, thought-controlled game, brain signals, AI, video game, innovation

og.title: FlapEEG - Thought-Controlled Video Game
og.description: Discover FlapEEG, a video game controlled by thought. Learn about our journey in training an AI model to interpret brain signals.

twitter.title: FlapEEG - Thought-Controlled Video Game
twitter.description: FlapEEG is a revolutionary video game controlled by thought. Learn how we trained an AI model to interpret brain signals and control the game.

image.alt: Three managers of the club, one wearing an EEG headset, smiling during a meeting

description.sr: FlapEEG is a thought-controlled video game powered by AI and EEG technology.
description.paragraph1: FlapEEG is a video game that is controlled by thought. We have trained an AI model to interpret brain signals and translate them into actions in the game. For this to work, we equipped ourselves with the latest EEG (electroencephalogram) technology,
description.paragraph2: The format of the game is simple; ever heard of flappy bird? Well, it's the same simple yet fun concept. The only difference is that you control the bird with your thoughts. The simple will to make the little character avoid obstacles is enough to make it move. We are very proud of the work we have accomplished; it may only be the beginning of a video game revolution! Think about it, what if we combined this mechanic to a VR headset? Or, what if this is the skipping stone to helping people with disabilities by giving them power from their own thoughts? The possibilities are endless.

louis.description: Main contributor to the project. Set up the server, custom interface and helped with coding

jordan.description: Handled data collection, annotation and cleaning

dereck.description: Author of this website, coded the baseline threshold and feature extraction algorithms

amen.description: Trained the AI model and helped the team understand the challenges

estelle.description: Trained the AI model and helped the team understand the challenges

hedi.description: Dealt with the data collection and protocols

william.description: Main contributor to the game development.

beginning.title: The Beginning

prototype.title: First Prototype
prototype.description: In the video above, you can see the first prototype of the game. Dereck and Louis-Étienne managed to get a simple version of the game up and running where the player could control the character by blinking with an activation threshold.

beginning.description: FlapEEG is a project that started in January 2025. The team consists of 8 members, some of whom are experienced in AI and EEG technology, while others are passionate about video games and coding. They all have different backgrounds and skills, but share the same goal.

dataCollection.title: Collecting Data (Week 2 - Week 4)
dataCollection.subtitle: Data Collection
dataCollection.paragraph1: After successfully establishing the baseline, Jordan recruited volunteers to collect brain data. The goal was to gather a dataset of brain signals while the volunteers played the game to train the AI model.
dataCollection.paragraph2: In the meantime, William finished the game and helped deploying the server with the help of Louis-Étienne.

image.alt: Screenshot of the FlapEEG game interface

filtering.title: Filtering & Training
filtering.subtitle: Filtering & Training
filtering.paragraph1: At this point in the project Louis found out our data wasn't properly filtered and there had a lot of noise which made it unusable. Jordan took care of this and found a way to filter out the noise.
filtering.paragraph2: In the meantime, Amen and Estelle were working hard training the AI model behind the scenes and paving the way for the others to understand the challenges of training a model.

challenge.title: First Challenge
challenge.description: At this point in the project, the team faced a significant challenge: the AI model was not performing as well as needed. They opted to start researching and reading papers to understand the challenges of training a model.

current.title: Current Progress
items: AI model is being continuously improved
Game mechanics are being refined for better experience
Team collaboration and testing in progress

next.title: What's Next?
items: Finalizing the AI model for real-time gameplay
Preparing for public demo and release
Exploring new applications for the technology

conclusion.line1: The FlapEEG project is still a work in progress.
conclusion.line2: Our team is getting closer every day to delivering a final product.

meta.title: F1Tenth - AI-Controlled Miniature Race Car Using Muscle Signals
meta.description: Explore F1Tenth, a groundbreaking student project that combines AI and electromyographic muscle signals to control a miniature race car. Learn about the innovative team's challenges and achievements.
meta.keywords: F1Tenth, AI, muscle signals, electromyographic bracelet, miniature race car, AI projects, student innovation

hero.title: F1Tenth - AI Meets Muscle Signals
hero.imageAlt: F1Tenth miniature race car controlled by AI and muscle signals
hero.description1: Thrill-seeker? This project will capture your interest! F1 Tenth is a team of students passionate about AI who have successfully combined human and machine. Using an electromyographic bracelet, they managed to control a miniature race car with their muscles.
hero.description2: The team had to train an AI model to read muscle electrical signals and translate them into actions. This involved extensive trial and error to adjust the model's sensitivity and accuracy. The bracelet has multiple sensors, each responsible for a different response like accelerating, braking, or turning. The project was very complex because it required controlling multiple dimensions simultaneously.

deoth.description: Team Lead, feasibility study, and more

theophile.description: Helped with conception, research, development and more

felix.description: Helped with software development, optimization, and validation

melek.description: Helped with software development, optimization, and validation

amy.description: Integration with F1 Tenth and partnership

sponsor.title: Special Thanks to those who made this project possible
sponsor.description: We would like to thank Sifi Labs for financing and helping this projet come to life. We would also like to extend our thanks to VAUL, the Laval University autonomous vehicle laboratory.

meta.title: Lenia - Continuous Cellular Automaton
meta.description: Explore Lenia, an advanced cellular automaton inspired by Conway's Game of Life. Discover emergent behaviors, self-organization, and the potential of artificial intelligence.
meta.keywords: Lenia, Cellular Automaton, Game of Life, Artificial Intelligence, Emergent Behaviors, Self-Organization, AI Research

og.title: Lenia - Continuous Cellular Automaton
og.description: Discover Lenia, a continuous cellular automaton that pushes the boundaries of self-organization and emergent behaviors in artificial intelligence.

twitter.title: Lenia - Continuous Cellular Automaton
twitter.description: Explore Lenia, an advanced cellular automaton inspired by Conway's Game of Life. Discover emergent behaviors, self-organization, and the potential of artificial intelligence.

continuous.title: Continuous Automaton
continuous.description: Beyond binary states of Game of Life

content.paragraph1: Artificial intelligence isn't just about neural networks or traditional algorithms. Some systems, based on simple rules, can generate astonishingly complex behaviors. This is the case with Lenia, an advanced cellular automaton inspired by the famous Game of Life by John Conway.
content.paragraph2: Unlike the Game of Life, where cells are either alive or dead and evolve in discrete steps, Lenia operates with continuous values and fluid time. This allows for the emergence of dynamic, self-organizing structures that behave in ways reminiscent of living organisms. Each pixel (or "cell") in Lenia has a numerical value, which can be thought of as the concentration of a chemical species. These cells interact with their surroundings using convolution filters, which determine how a cell "perceives" its neighbors. A convolution filter is essentially a weighted sum of nearby cell values, meaning that instead of just checking immediate neighbors, Lenia applies a structured pattern—often in the shape of a ring—to determine how different distances contribute to a cell's evolution. The result is then passed through a growth function, which decides whether a cell's value increases or decreases based on the surrounding environment. When applied across the entire grid, this process generates complex, lifelike behaviors from simple mathematical rules.
content.paragraph3: Our team successfully implemented a single-channel version of Lenia, where only one "chemical species" exists. However, we faced challenges in extending it to three channels, where multiple interacting species (represented as RGB values in visualization) would dramatically expand the possibilities for emergent behaviors. Unlike the Game of Life, which has a well-documented "bestiary" of interesting starting configurations, Lenia lacks a standardized library of known patterns, making it harder to find stable and fascinating structures.
content.paragraph4: This project offers an exciting opportunity to explore emergence in artificial intelligence, where complex behaviors arise from simple interactions. We invite students, researchers, and AI enthusiasts to join us in pushing the boundaries of self-organizing systems and discovering the hidden potential of Lenia.

meta.title: Manga Translator - AI-Powered Manga Translation
meta.description: Break the language barrier with our AI-powered Manga Translator. Translate manga panels in real-time and enjoy your favorite stories in multiple languages.
meta.keywords: Manga Translator, AI Manga Translation, Real-time Manga Translation, Manga109, Manga AI, Translate Manga, Japanese to English Manga Translation

og.title: Manga Translator - AI-Powered Manga Translation
og.description: Break the language barrier with our AI-powered Manga Translator. Translate manga panels in real-time.

twitter.title: Manga Translator - AI-Powered Manga Translation
twitter.description: Break the language barrier with our AI-powered Manga Translator. Translate manga panels in real-time and enjoy your favorite stories in multiple languages.

hero.subtitle: AI-Powered Manga Translation
hero.description: Ever wanted to read a manga that wasn't translated yet? Our AI-powered translator breaks the language barrier, bringing untranslated manga to readers worldwide in real-time.

realtime.title: Real-time Translation
realtime.description: Instantly translate manga panels without waiting for official releases

multilang.title: Multiple Languages
multilang.description: Support for translations between Japanese, English, French, and more

contextaware.title: Context-Aware
contextaware.description: Our AI understands character relationships and narrative context

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.paragraph1: Our project utilizes Manga109, a renowned dataset in the field, frequently employed for speech bubble detection, optical character recognition (OCR), and emotion recognition in illustrations.
approach.paragraph2: This comprehensive collection serves as the foundation for training our AI models to understand the unique visual language of manga and accurately translate text while preserving context.

example.caption: Sample output from our automatic translation system

step1.title: Prototype Development
step1.description: We started by leveraging existing tools to quickly build a functional prototype that could demonstrate the concept.

step2.title: Core Components
step2.description: Our system consists of bubble detection with U-Net segmentation, OCR-based text extraction, and automatic translation integration.

step3.title: Translation & Reinsertion
step3.description: After translation, we use advanced image processing to place the translated text back into speech bubbles while respecting visual context.

step4.title: Continuous Refinement
step4.description: We're constantly improving our models to handle challenges like text length differences and maintaining artistic integrity.

textResizing.title: Dynamic Text Resizing
textResizing.description: Intelligent adjustment of font size and text layout to ensure proper fitting within speech bubbles of varying sizes and shapes.

genderDetection.title: Character Gender Detection
genderDetection.description: Analyzing visual cues to detect character gender, improving translation accuracy for languages with grammatical gender like French.

characterId.title: Character Identification
characterId.description: Recognizing recurring characters to maintain consistent speech patterns and personality traits throughout translations.

contextAware.title: Context-Aware Translation
contextAware.description: Incorporating narrative context and visual information to produce more natural and accurate translations that respect the story's tone.

team.title: Meet Our Team
team.description: A diverse group of experts passionate about bringing manga to global audiences through cutting-edge AI technology.

meta.title: TreeCore - Simplifying Complex Data for Better Insights
meta.description: Discover how decision trees simplify complex datasets while maintaining interpretability. Learn about our research project and the team behind it.
meta.keywords: Decision Tree, Data Science, Interpretability, Research, Simplified Models

hero.title: TreeCore
hero.description1: TreeCore is a research project led by the AI Club that explores innovative ways to optimize the use of decision tree ensembles — a widely used model family in machine learning. The project focuses on two main goals: first, intelligently reducing datasets by keeping only the most relevant examples; and second, studying how many examples are truly necessary to reconstruct a trained decision tree.
hero.description2: Students involved in the project are encouraged to design, implement, and test algorithms in Python, experiment with real datasets, compare different training strategies, and interpret the outcomes critically. The project emphasizes scientific rigor and creative problem-solving, offering a great opportunity to experience what it’s like to run a real AI research project — from literature review and ideation to coding and experimental validation.
hero.description3: If you're curious, enjoy digging into how machine learning models actually work, and want to contribute to a meaningful and engaging team project, TreeCore is for you. No matter your current level, if you're motivated and eager to learn, there's a place for you — whether in coding, analysis, or even communication and outreach. The project will continue in the fall, and we’re actively looking for new members to join us!

team.title: Meet the team behind the project

hero.title: NutriNov
hero.subtitle: Food Innovation & AI Entrepreneurship
hero.paragraph1: NutriNov is an innovative entrepreneurial project aimed at revolutionizing the food sector through artificial intelligence. Our mission is to identify and solve concrete problems related to food by developing creative and viable technological solutions.
hero.paragraph2: In partnership with Open Food Facts, we leverage a comprehensive open database on food products to create intelligent systems that meet the real needs of consumers and industry professionals.

description.title: About the Project
description.mission: Our mission is to develop a creative and innovative solution to solve concrete problems related to food. The objective is to study existing problems in the food sector and design an intelligent and viable system to meet a real need.
description.approach: Initially, the project is entrepreneurship-oriented. We identify a problem and a target population to propose an innovative solution. Then, the project becomes more technical with the development of the solution in the form of a functional prototype and validated proof of concept.

partnership.title: Strategic Partnership
partnership.description: In collaboration with Open Food Facts and Louis Bastarache, we work on preparing and exploiting a comprehensive open database on food products and their nutritional compositions.

hero.title: Poppy Simulation
hero.subtitle: Reinforcement Learning for Humanoid Robot
hero.paragraph1: The Poppy Simulation project aims to develop artificial intelligence based on Reinforcement Learning to teach a Poppy humanoid robot to walk autonomously and stably.
hero.paragraph2: Training is performed in a sophisticated simulation environment to achieve robust and adaptive walking, with a view to future deployment on the physical robot. This project explores the exciting challenges of Sim-to-Real transfer.

team.title: Project Leadership
team.leads: Team Leads: Baptiste Bonin & Jonathan Caron-Roberge

meta.title: Poppy Conception - Open-Source Humanoid Robot | AI Club ULaval
meta.description: 3D printing, mechanical design and electronics for an open-source humanoid robot. Join the project to explore robotics and additive manufacturing.

hero.title: Poppy Conception
hero.subtitle: Building an Open-Source Humanoid Robot
hero.paragraph1: Join a multidisciplinary team to design and assemble a Poppy humanoid robot, entirely open-source. This project combines 3D printing, mechanical design, embedded electronics and programming to bring to life a robot capable of interacting with its environment.
hero.paragraph2: Unlike the Poppy Simulation project which focuses on AI, this project emphasizes physical fabrication and robot assembly. It's the perfect opportunity for hardware and manufacturing enthusiasts to get their hands dirty!

hero.title: Stochastic Gradient Descent, and Beyond!
hero.subtitle: Research in Stochastic Optimization
hero.paragraph1: Have you ever wondered why your AI model sometimes converges to a mediocre solution when it could do so much better? The answer often lies in the optimization algorithm.
hero.paragraph2: Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) is the engine behind training virtually all deep learning models. Yet, despite 20 years of use, this algorithm remains imperfect: it gets stuck in local minima and often misses the best solutions.

mission.title: Our Mission

understanding.title: Understand Why
understanding.description: Analyze in depth why SGD gets stuck in local minima and misses the best solutions

hypothesis.title: Our Hypothesis
hypothesis.description: Injecting intelligent 'noise' into the optimization process could help the model explore better solutions

goal.title: Concrete Objective
goal.description: Publish our results in a workshop-type conference

mission.status: The project is already well advanced — promising research avenues are identified and exploitation has begun. You're joining a team in full action!

objectives.title: Objectives & Deliverables
objectives.main: Submit a research paper to a workshop-type conference

weeks.description: Find the right balance between noise and gradient estimates

cta.title: Ready to Optimize Optimization?
cta.subtitle: Join the research team and contribute to science!
cta.description: If you love mathematical theory, programming and scientific research, this project combines everything you love.

meta.title: CANlock - CAN Anomaly Detection with Thales | AI Club ULaval
meta.description: Partner project with Thales for intelligent attack detection on vehicle CAN bus.

hero.title: CANlock
hero.subtitle: Secure tomorrow's vehicles with AI
hero.description: Help a cybersecurity team secure a fleet of ground vehicles by studying signals exchanged between sensors and actuators via the CAN (Controller Area Network) data bus. The goal: ensure the overall security of the vehicle, and by extension, that of its occupants.

items.title: AI / Data Science
items.desc: Proficiency in ML algorithms and data processing

items.title: Cybersecurity
items.desc: Interest in system and network security

threat.title: The Threat
threat.description: Modern vehicles integrate more and more embedded electronic units that exchange critical data via the CAN bus. An attacker who gains access to the CAN network can:

falsePositives.title: The False Positive Problem
falsePositives.description1: Current models achieve error rates of
falsePositives.signalsPerMinute: hundreds of thousands of signals per minute

main.title: Main Objective
main.description: Design a more performant anomaly detection model/algorithm to
main.description2: on the CAN bus, while identifying truly critical anomalies.

deliverables.title: Expected Deliverables
items: Data processing pipeline(s) and tested model(s)
Research article or proof of concept for Thales

items.description: Familiarization with the existing algorithm, tools and domain (CAN bus).
Proposal and study of improvement avenues.
Iterations on data processing and first model pipeline.
Mid-session report and progress presentation.
Improvement iterations and model testing.
Final tests, final technical report writing and documentation.

stack.title: Tech Stack
stack.note: GPU machine provided • CAN data available

items.title: Industrial Challenge
items.desc: You want to work on a concrete and critical cybersecurity challenge with a world leader (Thales).

items.title: AI for Security
items.desc: You're interested in AI applied to anomaly detection and protection of critical systems.

items.title: CV Experience
items.desc: You want to gain valuable and concrete experience that will impress on your CV.

hero.title: Drone Laser Tag
hero.subtitle: Autonomous Drone Competition
hero.paragraph1: The project consists of designing a drone and an autonomous driving algorithm to enable it to compete in a laser tag competition for drones. The objective: WIN! We'll try things, they won't work, we'll try others until it works.
hero.paragraph2: We're stepping off the beaten path and venturing to the frontier of what technology allows us to do. All while competing against other major Quebec universities! Buckle up, because this will be a project like no other.

gel.title: GEL / GIF
gel.description: Handle communication between the drone, central computer and all pipeline components. Optimize and minimize transmission latency. Emulate the controller to communicate with the Flight Controller.

simulation.title: Simulation
simulation.description: Design a complete simulation of the system and drones with Isaac Sim.

ai.title: AI / Code
ai.description: Design an object detector to detect enemy drones and estimate their orientation. Detect walls and ceiling to avoid collisions.

pilots.title: Pilots
pilots.description: Excellent FPV drone pilots playing laser tag with their drones. Their role: generate data to train the AI.

objectives.title: Project Objectives
objectives.subtitle: More specifically, the project consists of:

drone.title: Build the Drone
items: FPV drone with multiple sensors under 250g

deliverables.title: Expected Deliverables
items: AI capable of autonomously piloting the drone

commitment.title: Commitment Requirements
commitment.subtitle: This project requires serious commitment
items: Serious, motivated and committed profile required

items.title: Project at the Edge of Possible
items.description: Technological adventure at the frontier of what's achievable with current tech

items.title: University Competition
items.description: Face the best teams in Quebec in a real competition

items.title: Hardware + Software
items.description: Concrete project combining drone design, embedded AI and autonomous piloting

cta.title: Ready for the Adventure?
cta.subtitle: Join the team and participate in a unique competition!
cta.description: If you're ready to commit time, love extreme technical challenges and want to win, this project is for you.
